campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| Roll (d100) | Mishap |
|-------------|---------------------------------------------------------|
| 1-2 | You stumble and fall prone, becoming vulnerable to enemy attacks. |
| 3-4 | Your attack goes wide, leaving you exposed and granting your enemies advantage on their next attack against you. |
| 5-6 | Overexerting yourself, you take 1d4 strain damage. |
| 7-8 | You lose grip on your weapon and it lands 10 feet away from you. |
| 9-10 | You accidentally strike an unintended target within your reach. |
| 11-12 | Your weapon takes damage, reducing its effectiveness until repaired. |
| 13-14 | Your attack ricochets off your enemy and strikes you, dealing minimum weapon damage to yourself. |
| 15-16 | You twist your ankle, reducing your movement speed by 10 feet until you receive healing. |
| 17-18 | You strain your arm, and attacks with this arm suffer a disadvantage until you rest. |
| 19-20 | Your attack leaves you open for a counter, the next attack against you has advantage. |
| 21-22 | Your weapon gets lodged in the environment, requiring a strength check to free it. |
| 23-24 | You overbalance and your movement speed is halved on your next turn. |
| 25-26 | Distorted judgment causes you to become disoriented, suffering disadvantage on the next strength or dexterity check. |
| 27-28 | Your ill-placed attack shatters environmental cover, possibly revealing hidden enemies. |
| 29-30 | You exhaust yourself, you can perform only one action on your next turn. |
| 31-32 | Your weapon becomes entangled with an adversary's weapon, both of them require a strength check to free. |
| 33-34 | You inadvertently make a loud noise drawing unwanted attention. |
| 35-36 | A misstep puts distance between you and your enemy, they can take one step back without provoking an attack of opportunity. |
| 37-38 | Your overzealous attack leaves you dazed, you cannot take reactions until your next turn. |
| 39-40 | Your weapon flies out of your hand, landing in a random direction 20 feet away. |
| 41-42 | The enemy redirects your attack, you must succeed a strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet back. |
| 43-44 | You leave an opening in your defense, your AC is decreased by 2 until your next turn. |
| 45-46 | You hit a weak structure in the environment, causing debris to fall and dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage. |
| 47-48 | You injure your hand, you have disadvantage on attack rolls until you receive healing. |
| 49-50 | The strain of the attack makes you lose your breath, you cannot speak until your next turn. |
| 51-100 | Your attack fails but produces no additional negative side effect. |

## Ranged
| d100 Roll | Mishap Due to Critical Failure on Ranged Attack |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | The string on your bow snaps, rendering it useless until repaired.
| 2 | The projectile veers off course and hits an unintended target, roll for damage against the new target.
| 3 | You stumble and fall prone, wasting your next turn getting up.
| 4 | Your projectile ricochets off a hard surface, and you take half the attack damage.
| 5 | Your weapon jams or malfunctions. Its use requires repair or clearing before further use.
| 6 | The projectile launches backward, potentially hitting an ally. Roll a d20, on 10 or less, it hits an ally for half damage.
| 7 | You lose your grip and your weapon flies out of your hand, landing 10 feet away from you. 
| 8 | You misjudge your target's position, giving it an opportunity attack against you.
| 9 | Your lack of focus makes the next attack against you have an advantage.
| 10 | The string on your bow becomes unstrung. It takes a full round to fix it.
| 11 | You fail to notice a hazard in the environment; trip and fall, taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
| 12 | A strong gust blows your projectile off course, effective range of all your ranged attacks reduce by half until end of your next turn.
| 13 | Your misfire alerts nearby enemies to your location, expect reinforcements.
| 14 | Your weapon breaks from stress, you need to repair it before its next use.
| 15 | Your overdraw signficantly strains your muscles, reducing your Dexterity by 1 until you take a short or long rest.
| 16 | You accidentally shoot an item in your inventory, roll a d10 to determine which item is damaged.
| 17 | Your ammunition supply falls and scatters, you spend your next turn gathering it.
| 18 | You tear a muscle from the effort, your attacks have disadvantage until you receive healing.
| 19 | Your extensive focus on your target leaves you exposed, your AC is reduced by 2 until your next turn.
| 20 | You accidentally injure your hand, dealing 1d4 damage to yourself.
| 21-100 | No additional effect except for the failed attack. |

## Arcane
| Roll (d100) | Mishap |
| ------- | -------- |
| 1 | Your spell gets twisted in the air, striking an unintended target in immediate vicinity |
| 2 | You lose control over the spell energy. It implodes, silencing all magic within a 30-foot radius for 1 round |
| 3 | A surge of uncontrolled magic is pulled to you causing the casting of a random spell |
| 4 | A heavy drain of magical energy leaves you stunned for 1 round |
| 5 | The spell misfires, rebounding back at you for half damage |
| 6 | Your spell dubs and you are unable to cast that spell until the completion of a long rest |
| 7 | You accidentally draw from your life force. Lose hit points equal to half of your level |
| 8 | An arcane feedback loop forms. You cannot take reactions until your next turn |
| 9 | Wild magic infuses your form temporarily, changing your physical appearance randomly for 1 hour |
| 10 | Infernal energy infuses your spell, causing you to spontaneously speak in infernal language for 1 hour |
| 11-20 | For the next minute, you lose the ability to speak, and spells you cast with verbal component fail |
| 21-30 | The energies of your spell create mirages, giving everyone advantage on attack against you until your next turn |
| 31-40 | You summon an elemental spirit which becomes hostile and attacks |
| 41-50 | An unintended static field forms around you, pulling small objects towards you for 1 hour |
| 51-60 | You are wrapped in a cocoon of swirling colours that lasts until you manage to cast a spell successfully |
| 61-70 | Your spell cascades out of control, manifesting as a loud scream audible up to a mile away, drawing curiosity or danger |
| 71-80 | Arcane dislocation happens, you are teleported 30 feet in a random direction |
| 81-90 | Your spell causes colours around you to fade away, you are unable to see colours for the next 24 hours |
| 91-95 | A magic-eating parasite is drawn to the misfired spell, attaches to you, draining your magic until removed |
| 96-100 | A powerful magical being takes interest in your spell mishap, sending a minion to investigate |

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1-2 |Aari | A stern Aarakocra warrior who never lets his guard down. Adorned in leather armor crafted from strange beasts, feathers a mix of white and brown depicting his lineage. |
| 3-4 | Beaki | A calm, wise monk. Her plumage is dusky blue-grey and she often uses her wings to create a shroud-like hood while she meditates. |
| 5-6 | Cirro | A curious traveler with soft white feathers who is constantly assessing his surroundings. His demeanor is standoffish and secretive. |
| 7-8 | Dreko | A weathered, old Aarakocra who have seen countless battles. His feathers are largely gone, replaced by scars and calluses. |
| 9-10 | Ellion | An enthusiastic and friendly Aarakocra that is always ready to help. His feathers are a vibrant yellow, reflecting his sunny personality. |
| 11-12 | Fari | A female Aarakocra warrior, her feathers are a mix of bright red and orange. Her seriousness and uncompromising nature are well known among her peers. |
| 13-14 | Gorro | A male Aarakocra hunter, known for his exceptional tracking skills. His feathers are brown and grey and his sharp eyes miss nothing. |
| 15-16 | Hiiri | A healer Aarakocra with soothing sky-blue feathers. Hiiri is soft-spoken and empathetic, always willing to lend a helping wing to those in need. |
| 17-18 | Ikko | Fastidious and meticulous, with plumage of a neat and uniform ochre colour, he serves as town record-keeper and historian. |
| 19-20 | Jirri | A heavy-set Aarakocra, whose feathers have gone mostly grey. He runs one of the largest inns in the city. |
| 21-22 | Kiira | An instructor who takes great pride in teaching young Aarakocra the art of flight. Her snow-white feathers signify her high status. |
| 23-24 | Lorea | A cunning Aarakocra rogue, her dark brown and green plumage allows her to hide effectively in the trees. |
| 25-26 | Mekko | Serving as the community's wise elder, his age shows in all facets. His grey-white feathers sag heavily, and his eyes are more clouded than clear. |
| 27-28 | Nuri | A scholar whose plumage reflects her intellectual purviews, she meticulously maintains her feathers in the rich indigo colours of the teachers. |
| 29-30 | Orra | A master craftsman famed for his skillful hands. His natural rich brown plumage is often covered in flecks of wood and metal shavings. |
| 31-32 | Piri | A young, ambitious warrior, her fiery personality is reflected in her scarlet and gold plumage. |
| 33-34 | Quillo | A merchant known for his wares that hail from distant lands. His wing feathers present an array of earthy tones. |
| 35-36 | Rilla | A respected female guard captain whose deep blue-black plumage strikes an imposing figure. |
| 37-38 | Suri | An elder priestess whose feathers have turned an almonded white with age. She is often seen tending to the community's spiritual needs. |
| 39-40 | Tari | Calm and composed, this Aarakocra's feathers are dusky and her eyes steely; Tari earns her living as a bounty hunter. |
| 41-42 | Uri | A charismatic Aarakocra with vibrant purple feathers. Uri is a well-renowned bard who loves sharing tales of adventure. |
| 43-44 | Viri | Largely silent and isolated, Viri keeps her heavily mottled brown and black plumage cloaked in robes, out of sight. She is a known sorcerer. |
| 45-46 | Wiri | The community's blacksmith. His feathers are singed in places, and beads of sweat often cling to this dark, gold-speckled plumage. |
| 47-48 | Xerri | With feathers the color of bleached bone, Xerri is known as the white shadow, an assassin that has never been seen by its targets. |
| 49-50 | Yirri | A shy Aarakocra with feathers as green as the canopy trees she prefers to live in. She is a skilled herbalist known for her unique potions. |
| 51-52 | Zerri | A deceptively diminutive Aarakocra, whose petite stature hides a powerful magical ability. Her feathers glitter silver. |
| 53-100 | (Repeat Names) | Varying descriptions based on the Aarakocra above, accounting for their many different careers, ranks, and personalities. |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Seraphim | This Aasimar has a stern gaze and a commanding presence. Her golden eyes glint under the hood of her white cloak. |
| 2 | Uriel | His silver hair is neatly combed and his celestial markings are clearly visible on his skin. He carries an aura of tranquility. |
| 3 | Jophiel | This Aasimar is clad in leather armor, bearing symbols of a holy deity. Her vibrant, gold hair is set in a braid. |
| 4 | Raphael | His azure eyes shimmer with a sense of knowledge and wisdom. His beige robe gives him a scholarly appearance. |
| 5 | Gabriel | A strong and muscular Aasimar, Gabriel's steel blue eyes show a hint of his celestial lineage. |
| 6 | Metatron | Known for his fair and just nature, Metatron's wings shimmer under the sunlight, reflecting his divine heritage. |
| 7 | Raziel | This seemingly aloof Aasimar has flowing alabaster hair and his eyes radiate a mysterious glow. |
| 8 | Anael | A skilled warrior, Anael has a robust figure and her eyes glow with an undeniable determination. |
| 9 | Haniel | This Aasimar's silver hair is styled in a top knot, complementing his oriental inspired attire. |
| 10 | Raguel | With burnished bronze skin and lustrous gold eyes, he exudes an air of nobility and honor. |
| 11 | Chamuel | His battle-scarred armor does not hide the benevolent spirit radiating from his amethyst eyes. |
| 12 | Zadkiel | Dressed in a royal blue mantle, this wise and elderly Aasimar carries an aura of calmness around him. |
| 13 | Auriel | Her strict demeanor does not mask the compassion that lies within her. She dons a set of elegant plate armor. |
| 14 | Ishim | Portraying an air of sophistication, Ishim's celestial markings make his noble lineage clear. |
| 15 | Izidkiel | His crimson hair contrasts strikingly with his celestial markings. He carries a stern, yet understanding gaze. |
| 16 | Sahaqiel | His elegant posture is unruffled by the heavy spear in his hands. He carries a countenance of unwavering resolution. |
| 17 | Munkar | This Aasimar carries an air of silent contemplation. His crystal eyes and ash-gray hair hint at his celestial lineage. |
| 18 | Leliel | Green eyes shimmering with a mystic light, she carries an aura of quiet assurance. |
| 19 | Peliel | Wearing a golden circlet, this highly distinguished Aasimar has a steady and solemn gaze. |
| 20 | Asaradel | His ice-blue eyes glisten with a mysterious light under his hooded cloak. A cryptic aura envelops him. |
| .... | .... | .... |
| 100 | Yophiel | With burning golden eyes and long silver hair, Yophiel is known for her wisdom and tranquility. She carries an aura of serene authority. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name         | Description                                                                                                                        |
|------------|--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1-2        | Gurg         | A brooding Bugbear covered in scars and wearing patchwork armor.                                                                   |
| 3-4        | Klak         | A towering Bugbear with deep-set eyes and twisted horns.                                                                           |
| 5-6        | Bok          | An agile young Bugbear who brandishes a crude spear.                                                                               |
| 7-8        | Murg         | A nervous Bugbear trembling from the raw energy of his magical ability.                                                            |
| 9-10       | Vrash        | A stoic Bugbear warrior who wears a tattered red cape over his heavy armored chestplate.                                          |
| 11-12      | Skrag        | A haggard Bugbear with cunning eyes, known for his expertise in setting traps.                                                     |
| 13-14      | Grith        | A lean, mean Bugbear with a sharp mind and even sharper blades.                                                                    |
| 15-16      | Snurg        | Burly Bugbear, his body well-muscled from years of voracious combat.                                                               |
| 17-18      | Drag         | A jittery Bugbear with several jingle bells tied into his fuzzy mane.                                                              |
| 19-20      | Flog         | A hefty Bugbear hunter with piercing green eyes.                                                                                   |
| 21-22      | Zog          | A stocky Bugbear, with a resting face that portrays a deep-seated discontent with the world around him.                            |
| 23-24      | Gruz         | Elderly Bugbear with a sage-like presence, adorned with ceremonial paint in recognition of the respect afforded to him by his tribe.|
| 25-26      | Brag         | The proud chieftain of his Bugbear clan, with a commanding bellow almost as impressive as his colossal stature.                    |
| 27-28      | Urg          | A stoic Bugbear with a gaze as hard as stone, carrying the burden of his past like a second set of armor.                          |
| 29-30      | Kret         | A tribal shaman Bugbear, his body covered in painted symbols of power and devotion to his ancestors.                                |
| 31-32      | Bog          | A Bugbear innkeeper with a friendly smile, known for weaving enchanting tales about his past exploits.                             |
| 33-34      | Vrut         | A somber Bugbear who functions as the spiritual leader of his tribe, respected and held in awe by all members.                      |
| 35-36      | Ugrat        | A Bugbear scribe with a particular affinity for ancient rune carving.                                                              |
| 37-38      | Nark         | A Bugbear bandit with keen eyes and nimble fingers, known for being fiercely loyal to his brethren.                                |
| 39-40      | Grak         | A Legendary Bugbear Warrior wielding a massive warhammer.                                                                          |
| 41-50      | Narr         | A Bugbear blacksmith known for the elegance and practicality of his weaponry.                                                      |
| 51-60      | Drot         | A seasoned Bugbear scout, no path in the wilderness is unknown to him.                                                             |
| 61-70      | Trug         | Skilled Bugbear tamer, known for his uncanny ability to communicate and control wild beasts.                                      |
| 71-80      | Lurk         | A Bugbear raider with a penchant for causing chaos from the shadows.                                                               |
| 81-90      | Uldak        | A wary Bugbear who is the first line of defense of his tribe, his eyes constantly scanning the horizon for threats.                |
| 91-100     | Klad         | A feared Bugbear warlord, having attained his status through strength and cunning, his word is law among his tribe.                 |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Eolande | A solemn figure, Eolande's shifting features regularly adopt the countenances of those they frequently interact with. |
| 2 | Carric | With sharp, discerning eyes, Carric avoids revealing his true face, instead projecting an authoritative, solid image. |
| 3 | Phyrra | Regardless of borrowed form, Phyrra carries an undeniable aura of mystique and silent strength. |
| 4 | Oedi | Quick to adopt a form pleasing to others, Oedi wears expressions like masks, rarely revealing his true emotions. |
| 5 | Dyvim | An imposing figure, Dyvim often shapes themselves into images of strength, opting for intimidation over deception. |
| 6 | Rinn | A striking, svelte form, Rinn's fluidity of changes and emotion defy clear categorization. |
| 7 | Gywnneth | An air of ethereal grace clings to Gwynneth, whether she takes the form of a noblewoman or a common servant. |
| 8 | Thaco | Thaco frequently embodies the likeness of skilled craftspeople, using their appearances to gain trust. |
| 9 | Cain | A stern, no-nonsense persona, Cain's mastery in mimicking a soldier is both impressive and fearsome. |
| 10 | Seren | Beneath a plethora of disguises, Seren's true form remains shrouded in enigma and intrigue. |
| 11 | Riale | Knowledgeable and enigmatic, Riale's forms are as varied as the array of topics they mastered. |
| 12 | Kizziar | Exceedingly inscrutable, Kizziar hops between faces more frequently than some people change clothes. |
| 13 | Veil | An observer and a listener, Veil uses their transformations to blend in and go unnoticed. |
| 14 | Naelis | Rarely seen in their native form, Naelis performs seamless transitions between meticulously studied personas. |
| 15 | Shava | Shava's controlled changes facilitates her infiltration into both high society and lowly slums. |
| 16 | Cailen | Adopts the image of fresh-faced youth or a grizzled veteran with consummate ease to manipulate others' perceptions. |
| 17 | Lireal | Encountered often as a stoic warrior, it's unclear where Lireal's guises end and the real changeling begins. |
| 18 | Kieran | Kieran's forms range from imposing to inconspicuous, his true features seldom seen. |
| 19 | Iolande | Often seen as a shadowy figure, Iolande's true face is as mysterious as the night. |
| 20 | Jorael | Utilizing a wide range of appearances, Jorael fascinates and mystifies with his many faces. |
| 21-100 | (Repeat above or leave blank as needed) | (Repeat above or leave blank as needed) |

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Zephyros | Ancient and wise, Zephyros is a gold dragon with scales that glow like the morning sun. |
| 2 | Vraximyor | With deep red scales, Vraximyor is a young and impulsive dragon who is always quick to action. |
| 3 | Ishythus | A silver dragon who is known for his wisdom and his penchant for riddles. |
| 4 | Krorthax | A black dragon who relishes in spreading fear and chaos amongst humans and elves. |
| 5 | Quor'dumal | An intimidating presence, Quor'dumal is a brutish blue dragon who is always surrounded by a crackling aura of static electricity. |
| 6 | Grakkarion | Grakkarion, a white dragon with a cold, icy stare, is known to reign over the snowy cliffs. |
| 7 | Shruikan | Shruikan, a dragon of an unknown type, is infamous for his petrifying gaze and gigantic wingspan. |
| 8 | Elimumor | An emerald green dragon, Elimumor is known for her calm demeanor and affinity with plants and herbs. |
| 9 | Rythanthar | An old and sagely bronze dragon, Rythanthar prefers diplomacy over violence. |
| 10 | Theraggon | A copper dragon that revels in mischief and pranks for his amusement. |
| 11-15 | Maelthra | Maelthra, a black dragon with scales as dark as midnight, is known for her cunning and deceit. |
| 16-20 | Aothra | A gold dragon, Aothra is revered for her benevolence and wisdom. |
| 21-25 | Xanmyriel | Xanmyriel, a white dragon, is feared for her icy wrath and imposing presence. |
| 26-30 | Iridyphia | A blue dragon who revels in the storms and lightning, Iridyphia is both awe-inspiring and terrifying. |
| 31-35 | Togervithar | Togervithar, a green dragon, is known for his cunning and affinity with poisonous plants. |
| 36-40 | Davxithar | A silver dragon, Davxithar is a resourceful and intelligent practitioner of arcane arts. |
| 41-45 | Noromythyus | A red dragon, Noromythyus demands tribute from the mountain dwarves that live beneath his mountain. |
| 46-50 | Sylphyria | Sylphyria, a bronze dragon, is an ambivalent watcher of the coasts and protector of seafarers. |
| 51-55 | Balitor | A massive copper dragon, Balitor is known for his love of collecting and hoarding all kinds of treasures. |
| 56-60 | Ybrynthor | Ybrynthor, a brass dragon, enjoys conversing in various languages and collecting stories from the various races. |
| 61-65 | Xyrthungar | Xyrthungar, a red dragon, broods over his kingdom in the heart of an active volcano. |
| 66-70 | Lorrithak | With scales that shimmer like the night sky, Lorrithak is an ancient, peace-loving silver dragon. |
| 71-75 | Brornigath | A black dragon, Brornigath lives in the deepest part of the forest, unfriendly to any who dare intrude. |
| 76-80 | Yllaetha | A serene sea-green dragon, Yllaetha is known for her mesmerizing, hypnotic eyes. |
| 81-85 | Grorgharesh | Grorgharesh, an imposing blue dragon, has an insatiable curiosity that leads him to explore human cities in disguise. |
| 86-90 | Zerthumanth | A brass dragon, Zerthumanth loves riddles and will generously reward any who can solve his. |
| 91-95 | Fyrzarrin | With scales that gleam like emeralds, Fyrzarrin is a green dragon who rules over the forest creatures. |
| 96-100 | Helrathum | Helrathum, a gold dragon, is revered by mountain-folk for his wisdom and fierce protection. |

## Duergar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Krarag Ironfist | A stout duergar with a glossy beard, Krarag is a stonemason who takes immense pride in his creations. |
| 2 | Gormar the Stern | Gormar is a duergar blacksmith, known for his brows that are always furrowed in deep thought. |
| 3 | Korlen Graymantle | Fiery and determined, Korlen is a duergar poet who captures the stark beauty of the Underdark in her verses. |
| 4 | Erdek Stonebeard | A firm and stoic duergar cleric, Erdek devotes all of his time to serving his deity. |
| 5 | Thulnum Hardhelm | Thulnum is a duergar warrior known for his unbreakable will in the heat of battle. |
| 6 | Gura Deeproot | A quiet yet sharp-eyed duergar ranger, Gura is a proficient tracker in the labyrinthine tunnels of the Underdark. |
| 7 | Durnar Flintarm | Durnar is a duergar alchemist, known for his potent poisons and ironclad health potions. |
| 8 | Thane Ironhewer | The prodigious architect Thane is responsible for many of the sturdy duergar fortifications dotting the Underdark. |
| 9 | Durdek Steelshadow | A duergar rogue known for his silent footfalls and unseen strikes, Durdek is an expert in stealth. |
| 10 | Khardun Darkdelver | Khardun, a daunting duergar sorcerer, holds command over ancient and intricate spells of the earth. |
| ... | ... | ... |
| 97 | Dhulark Hammerhands | A burly, hardened duergar warrior, whose hands seem forged from steel. |
| 98 | Gralgar Frostbeard | Gralgar is a duergar survivor, his frosty beard a testament to his chilling ordeals in the upper world. |
| 99 | Thordran Deephelm | Thordran, a reclusive duergar scholar, is an expert in ancient Underdark history and lore. |
| 100 | Skarag Goldvein | Skarag is a wealthy duergar merchant, who earned his fortune from underdark mineral trading and his ear, always attune to the stone’s whisper of gold. |

## Dwarves
| Dice Value | Name       | Description                                                                                   |
|------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1-2        | Thargrim   | An elder and wise dwarf, Thargrim was once a respected blacksmith in his underground community |
| 3-4        | Dain        | A grizzled veteran of numerous battles, Dain has a stern demeanor and a disciplined mind        |
| 5-6        | Balgor     | An isolated hermit, Balgor prefers having conversations with his pet wolverine rather than people      |
| 7-8        | Fargus     | Self-claimed master of ale brewing, Fargus is known for his hearty laughter and never-ending tales                  |
| 9-10       | Norik       | An eminent scholar, Norik has dedicated his life to the chronicles of dwarven history                                   |
| 11-12      | Hogni      | Chief of his clan and a skilled tactician, Hogni commands respect and admiration from his kin                          |
| 13-14      | Kili         | A young dwarf with dreams of venturing into the surface world and seeking out new allies                                |
| 15-16      | Durin       | A stone mason known for his intricate carvings, Durin is a renowned artisan in his town                               |
| 17-18      | Ghim       | Former miner, Ghim carries a heavy pickaxe and tells tales of a mysterious gemstone he found in the deepest tunnels            |
| 19-20       | Thror      | A charismatic trader, Thror is skilled in bartering and haggling with even the shrewdest merchants                      |
| 21-22       | Nogrim   | A recluse, Nogrim spends his days cataloging his extensive collection of precious metals and rare minerals                 |
| 23-24      | Orik        | A no-nonsense dwarf who advocates discipline and order, Orik is known to enforce the rules strictly in his community                |
